title: Why was it acceptable and expected for male game show hosts to kiss female contestants on the mouth in the seventies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can you cite your examples of this happening? Because I can only think of one: Richard Dawson on Family Feud. Why was it acceptable? Donald Trump said it most famously, just replace “grab their you-know-what” with “kiss them on the lips”. It was Dawson’s thing, and part of the schtick of being on the show. I suppose it reinforced accepted gender roles of the time. But I can’t think of other top hosts of the time (Dick Clark, Bob Eubanks, Wink Martindale, Bill Cullen, Jim Perry, etc) who did the same thing. Possibly Gene Rayburn on occasion, but if so that also fit with the more risque (and inebriated) nature of Match Game.
